basic.enzyme criteria: provide a comprehensive sampling of the prokaryotic HAD phosphatase family for function prediction/validation
basic.chemical family: alcohol sugar monophosphate(34), acid sugar monophosphate(33), aldol sugar monophosphate(28), di and tri phosphates(20), nucleoside monophosphate and related(17), ketose sugar monophosphate(10), sugar bisphosphates(8), amino acid and related(6), amino sugars(3), easily hydrolyzed(3), phosphonate(3), disaccharides(2)
basic.chemical criteria: known metabolites, pNPP for low level activity, structurally related to known metabolites to define the substrate specificity and as clues to new function. Reflect the metabolism of E. coli

experiment.organism: pNIC28-Bsa4 vector containing the insert of interest was transformed into BL21(DE3) E. coli containing the pRIL plasmid
experiment.high throughput technology: Biomek FX; Beckman Coulter, Evolution P3 liquid handling system
experiment.activity indicator: use malachite-green reagent(BioMol Green (Enzo Life Sciences)) to screen via an end-point inorganic phosphate-release assay at 650 nm

model.description: The sequence-similarity network (SSN) previously described by the laboratories (10.1073/pnas.1423570112) was used to select targets for functional analysis. The clustering of the network leads to selection of orthologs by sampling within the clusters and selection of diverse functions by sampling across clusters. And for a balanced sample, the cap domain distribution was retained as the whole SSN sequence sets.
model.chemical descriptors: ROCS(rapid overlay of chemical structures (ROCS) alignment with electrostatic comparison) to analyze the similarity

process.curation: Query the uniprot db for sequence; Query the pubchem for 3D structure.
